alert.note: Alert for Choctaw (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 24 at 11:59AM CDT by NWS Mobile
info.description: The National Weather Service in Mobile has issued a * Urban and Small Stream Flood Advisory for... Southwestern Choctaw County in southwestern Alabama... Northern Clarke County in southwestern Alabama... Northern Wayne County in southeastern Mississippi... * Until 300 PM CDT. * At 1159 AM CDT, Heavy showers and thunderstorms continue to redevelop over portions of Wayne, Choctaw, and Clarke Counties producing heavy rainfall. This will continue to spread southward over the next few hours, potentially resulting in urban and small stream flooding. Up to 2 inches of rain have fallen fallen in portions of the area. * Some locations that will experience flooding include... Waynesboro, Thomasville, Silas, Coffeeville, Souwilpa, Bolinger, Collumburg, Bladon Springs, Aquilla, Isney, Emory, Contwell, West Bend, Gretna, Cunningham, Woods Bluff, Smyer, Failetown, McEntyre and Boice. Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 3 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
